perturbation.original_text:
On or before the fifteenth (15th) calendar Day of each Month, Transporter shall provide to Customer an invoice and statement for the previous Month setting forth the calculation of the net amount due hereunder to Transporter for the Services provided hereunder during such previous Month.
Payment of Statements. Within fifteen (15) calendar Days following receipt of each of Transporter’s invoices and statements, Customer shall make payment to Transporter of all undisputed amounts by wire transfer, in accordance with the account information provided to Customer, unless another form of payment is agreed to in writing by the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
On or before the thirtieth (30th) calendar Day of each Month, Transporter shall provide to Customer an invoice and statement for the previous Month setting forth the calculation of the net amount due hereunder to Transporter for the Services provided hereunder during such previous Month.
Payment of Statements. Within five (5) calendar Days following receipt of each of Transporter’s invoices and statements, Customer shall make payment to Transporter of all undisputed amounts by wire transfer, in accordance with the account information provided to Customer, unless another form of payment is agreed to in writing by the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: The change modifies the payment terms to create a legal contradiction. The original agreement states that payment must be made within fifteen (15) days of receiving the invoice. The modification reduces this to five (5) days, which may be considered an unreasonably short timeframe, especially considering the complexities of gas transportation agreements, potentially violating regulations related to fair business practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates fair business practice regulations and standards of 'reasonable time' for payment processing.

perturbation.original_text: Each Party agrees to keep its records and books in accordance with generally accepted accounting practices in the oil and gas industry. Each invoice and statement shall be final as to both Parties unless questioned in writing within twenty four (24) Months following the date of such invoice or statement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party agrees to keep its records and books in accordance with internal accounting practices. Each invoice and statement shall be final as to both Parties unless questioned in writing within six (6) Months following the date of such invoice or statement.
perturbation.explanation: The change shortens the timeframe for disputing invoices from twenty-four (24) months to six (6) months. This timeframe is unreasonably short, potentially conflicting with statutes of limitations for breach of contract or fraud claims under Texas law. The agreement mandates adherence to 'internal accounting practices' instead of the generally accepted accounting practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Conflicts with Texas statutes of limitations for breach of contract and fraud claims, potentially violating regulatory requirements for financial record keeping.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue in full force and effect until the end of the fifteenth (15th) Contract Year, and shall continue in full force and effect thereafter until terminated by either Party by providing thirty (30) calendar days’ prior written notice of termination to the other Party (such fifteen (15) Contract Year period, as may be further extended as provided herein is referred to as the “Term”).
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue in full force and effect until the end of the fifteenth (15th) Contract Year, and shall continue in full force and effect thereafter until terminated by either Party by providing five (5) calendar days’ prior written notice of termination to the other Party (such fifteen (15) Contract Year period, as may be further extended as provided herein is referred to as the “Term”).
perturbation.explanation: The modification reduces the notice period required for terminating the agreement from thirty (30) days to five (5) days. This drastically shortened timeframe may be considered commercially unreasonable, particularly given the complexities and potential disruptions associated with gas transportation agreements. This could be challenged under contract law principles requiring reasonable notice for termination.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with general contract law principles requiring reasonable notice for termination, specifically in complex commercial agreements.
